page.title: 07SAND PROCESSING TECHNIQUES
page.content:
Sand is screened by passing it through piano wire mesh to remove anything above 3/36 inches size. The screens are double layer which means that the top layer is larger so that big lumps can not fall on to the piano wires . After screening the sand is washed through vibrating screens filled with water jets to break up and remove clay and other large particles.
Drying and grading comes next when the sand is passed through oilfired rotary barrels before going to the grading screens. Here it is sorted into 4 main grades varying from 2mm to 250 microns over a four deck rotex screen.
The sand is then transported in 50kg bags or sent to storage silos.
